action.action-desc: Ms. Bynum (for herself and Mr. Steube) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Health and Human Services, acting through the Commissioner of Food and Drugs, to conduct a study, and submit to Congress a report, on the human health impacts of exposure to microplastics in food and water.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Microplastics Safety Act.

section.header: FDA study and report on human health impacts of exposure to microplastics in food and water

subsection.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services, acting through the Commissioner of Food and Drugs (in this section referred to as the Secretary) shall conduct a study on the human health impacts of exposure to microplastics in food and water. The study shall—

paragraph.text: identify the major pathways of human exposure to microplastics;
address the impact of such exposure on—
address such other areas of importance as the Secretary determines appropriate.

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report that describes—

paragraph.text: the findings and conclusions of the study under subsection (a); and
recommendations for legislative or administrative action to address the human health impacts of exposure to microplastics in food and water.
